### PLAN YOUR VISIT

Welcome to your guide for planning the perfect visit to Great Explorations. We're thrilled to be a part of your family's adventure in curiosity and exploration. Here's all the information you need to make the most of your experience.

## WHAT TO EXPECT

### Visitor Play Policy:

The beauty of being a child is the ability to see the world with a fresh perspective. There are magical qualities in every aspect of life, ready to be revealed around each corner. A piece of paper is not just for writing; it can be a plane that takes you to faraway lands. While the everyday couch can transform into a secret castle protecting endless riches. At Great Explorations, imagination empowers our next generation of learn...

### GENERAL

  * Free for children under 12 months
  * $15 for kids age 1â€“17
  * $12 for adults

### MUSEUMS FOR ALL

Present your WIC, SNAP, or standard EBT (Electronic Benefit Transfer)card upon arrival to enjoy a discounted admission rate of just $3 per person any day of the week. This special offer is valid for up to five family members.

### DISCOUNTS

Get $1 off admission for

  * Military Families
  * Teachers
  * First Responders
  * AAA
  * Senior Citizens

## ACCESSIBILITY

## Parking

Our free parking lot is also accessible to all types of transportation including buses, vans and cars. Designated handicap parking spaces are located to the west of the front entrance. Service animals are welcome in the Museum.

## Wheelchairs

The museum is accessible to wheelchair users and other visitors who need to avoid stairs. Our gallery floor has an open floor plan for easy accessibility, and exhibits are designed to be wheelchair friendly.

## Sensory

Great Explorations welcomes individuals with autism and their families. The museum is listed as Autism Friendly in the Center for Autism and Related Disabilities (CA...
